description: From the Late Latin exorbitāns, the present active participle of exorbitō (“I go out of the track”), from ex (“out”) + orbita (“wheel-track”); see orbit. Compare the French exorbitant.

adjectives.description: exorbitant (comparative more exorbitant, superlative most exorbitant)

entries.meaning: Exceeding proper limits; excessive or unduly high; extravagant.
examples: It’s a nice car, but they are charging an exorbitant price for it.
You also have to pay exorbitant interest if you have credit card debt.
